disputant: Libberian market women and Guinean security
actionplancommittee: Samuel Bontor,Nelson Slekpo,Thomas  Gonotee,Emmanuel Larkpor,Agenline Yeke.
actionplandescription: Issue discussed by Bonlah CF members and referred to Yarmein DSC to be addressed before December 11, 2015.
actionplannotes: Pc to follow up on progress of DSC role in resolving this international  dispute
issuedescription:
Ten market women  from   New Yekepa town in Liberia were  arrested by Guinean soldiers at the frontier between  the  Guinean town of Gbar and New Yekepa for the women refusal to pay 20,000GF(Guinea currency)  to them. A Liberia man (Saye Guanue) who was also on his way from the same Guinean market in the town of Bossou was also arrested and   flogged for attempting to advocate on the women’s behalf. The situation became worst when three Guinean women (one pregnant) alleged that Saye Guanue,the alleged victim of soldier brutality had himself beaten on  the three Guinean women who were returning from Liberia  to Guinea in reprisal. Of the military brutality against him earlier.
This was reported to a member of the Bonlah CF from the town of New Yekekpa,Ageline Yeke.
issuenotes:
What was the 20,000 FG meant for?
Is the  route used by the Liberian market women the official road to and fro Guinea?
Why was Saye Guanue flogged? advocacy?
Who will take the lead in resolving this internal dispute?

disputant: The people of Old Yourpea  and Beatuo towns.
actionplancommittee: Jefferson Kraie,Sampson Sayon,Justina Kwitti,Oretha Bantu,Margan Sonyah and Robert Duco
actionplandescription: The committee will do a referral through written communication  to chairman of the Nimba County Security Council in Sanniquellie for their prompt intervention as  this boundary has the  potential to erupt into violence owing to its ethnic dimension.
actionplannotes: Yourpea Old Town seems to be more considerate on the boundary issue. They even offered to accept sharing of the disputed land between the two parties. So it can be like a win-win-situation.Beatuo keeps her grounds on reason that they had in the past made several concessions for peace in  the  area, but this time around will stand firm until their concerns are addressed by the DSC or CSC.
mediationoutcome: Parties maintained their position until CSC intervention.
issuedescription: Before 2003,the people of Yourpea Old Town and Beatuo were living together peacefully.There was no disagreement over their common boundary.But the last phase of the Liberia civil war which brought into the pitcure MODEL(Movement for Peace and Democracy in Liberia) whose membership was predominately Krahn ,opposed to president Taylor’s rule, fought btterly against government forces, predominately Gio thereby giving rise to friction between the people of Old Yourpea(Krahn) and Beatuo(Gio).During the fight, Old Yourpea youth fighting on the side of MODEL burnt houses and killed tens of Beatuo while in reprasal,Beatuo did likewise. This situation has now been reduced to fight over farming areas by both communities holding in mind the bitter experience of the war.
issuename: Boundary dispute between Old Yourpea and Beatuo towns
issuenotes: Will the CSC take referrals  serious? What plan could be  hatched to make be more proactive the resolution of the dispute. Has  any thing been done by KDSC or  DCF to heal the wounds of the past? . What if the CSC decides  to share the disputed  land in half  between the contenders.
statusnotes: This boundary dispute is still  ongoing because the joint mediation team of the Kparblee DSC and Dubuzon CF attempt with MLDL support on December 8-9 ended in a deadlock as both parties( Old Tqwn and Beatuo) could not reach a common on the disagreement over their boundary. This situation has the potential to erupt into violence if nothing is done promptly.

disputant: Yourpea Old town led by Gibson Kpor and Yourpea New nTown led byGonpue Larmie
actionplancommittee: Sampson Sayo ,Oretha Bantu,Jefferson Kraie,Alexander Tenty Jonathan Tarue and Justina Kwitti
actionplandescription: A committee was set up to work out moralities The MLDL pro of  the remaining activities leading  to the demarcation and  erection of a permanent corner stone that will serve as the symbol  of peace and stability.
actionplannotes: The MLDL  Program will provide support to implement the plan that will drawn by the action plan committee for lasting resolution of the dispute.
issuedescription: The people of Old and New Yourpea Towns have for the last five years had disagreement over the boundary that seperates the two towns.Old Yourpea claims a huge flat rock(Known as Kerborkern) located between it and   New Town as the main boundary while New town disputes it and maintain that the original boundary is the creek called Garnee.During separate sessions with the disputants,both parties took like position. They unanimously agreed to form a new boundary mid-way the distance between  old and new yourpea towns for the sake of peace and security of their area.
issuename: Boundary dispute between Yourpea Old Town and Yourpea New town
issuenotes: Now that the parties to this boundary dispute have agreed to establish a new boundary,will the county surveyors be a part of this process?
statusnotes: This dispute has been mediated and resolved by the Kparblee DSC and Dubuzon CF joint mediation team.Both parties agreed to  establish a new boundary between the two towns.

disputant: Mandingos ,Mano,Gio and other tribes residing in Ganta
actionplandescription: N/A

resolution: N/A
issuedescription: A day long land education training was conducted by MLDL program in Ganta on December 17,2015 at the Ganta Concern  Women Business Center.Beneficiaries of this training included the 17 administrative district  commissioners of Nimba,the five statutory district superintendents,the six city mayors a Female paramount chief, representatives of,civil societi organizations in Nimba County and 25 disputants  in the Ganta land crises.The disputants were predominantely of the Mandingo tribe who feels rejected by  their Mano and Gio brothers and sisters.The goal of the training was to  expose to Nimba stakeholders and disputants over land in Ganta the procedures in acquiring land in Liberia,The training also drill participants through the topics:Types of land in Liberia,Property ownership,Inheritence law,Types of property
issuenotes: N/A
statusnotes: The Ganta land education training was successfully held on the 17th of December,2015 at the Ganta Concern Women Business Center.It brought to 75 participats including 25 disputants ,17 district commissioners,5 CSC menbers among others.

actionplandescription:
On December 18, 2015, Mr. Amos Gbannah,Nimba County Information Officer proxy for  superintendent Fong G, Zuagele to launch the Ganta Peace Conference and establish the conference resolution secretariat ,Mr.AmosGbannah used the occasion to call on conference participants especially the 25 disputants in the Ganta land conflict to seek resolution of their land disputes through peace means.Mr. Gbannah thanked he MLDL family for organizing the Ganta Peace Conference on land crises in Ganta.He asserted that MLDL intervention in supporting mediation efforts in Nimba County has lessen some burdens on the county administration in the face of limited resources available for such purpose.
Providing the over view and goal of the conference, MLDL program manager, Mr. Martins Sopp informed the participants that the MLDL program is in Liberia to mentor and support communities and local government through established structures suchas the Community Forums, District Security Councils and County Security Councils in identifying, prioritizing and resolving community security concerns early enough before they erupt into full scale violence. It is in this vein that the Ganta land situation has drawn the attention of MLDL program as potential town bomb for violence. Mr. Sopp concluded by calling on the Ganta land disputants to see the peace  conference as a platform for   frank discussions and setting the pace for resolving disputes through peaceful means.
The Ganta Peace Conference was characterized by presentations and interactive forum by participants and key Nimba County stakeholders including superintendent Fong G. Zuagele, County Attorney Cllr. Hector Quoiguah,Catholic Justice and Peace Commission coordinator for NimbaMr.JescoDavis, Network of Trainers for Transformation director Mr. Nya Flomo,Nimba land Coordination Center coordinator Mr. Gabriel Varmie,Nimba County chief land surveyor Mr. Jessie Gaypea,Tappita District female paramount chief Mrs. Julia Freeman and Ganta City mayor Ben Dokpah.
Each speaker stressed on PEACE & SECURITY as key factor for community growth and development and urged disputants in the Ganta land disputes to seek redress through the MLDL created Ganta Community Forum or the Bain-Garr District Security Council.
Superintendent Zuagele, also chairman of the Nimba County Security Council (NCSC) deliberated on the topic: PEACE & SECURITY, lead factor for social, economic and political growth and development of a state. He said peace can only be sustained when actors in peace process are sincere, honest and speak the truth about issues that affect the community. Chairman Zuagele informed the participants that due to the absence of the chief elder of Ganta, Mr. Nya Tylor Guanue who is the official spokesperson for the Mano and Gio ethnic group in Ganta.Thu peace conference will continue in January 2016.
In order to prepare the ground for continuation of the Ganta Peace Conference in 2016 as proposed by the superintendent, the following individuals were appointed by the superintendent to work with disputants and county stakeholders to organize with MLDL support another conference where disputants will sign conference resolution denouncing violence as the way to seek redress to conflicts. Those named on the

statusnotes: Disputants from the side of the Mandingos were all present along with some of the disputants from the Mano and Gio ethnic group.The conference secretariat is working with  the disputants to plan for the  next phase in January 2016.Key members of the Mano side including Mr. Nya Taylor Guanue,chief elder of Bain-Garr. did not attend.

actionplancommittee:
Ganta CF mediation committee
Sampson Quanue
Franklin Torkar
Angie Freeman
Sei Tensonnon
actionplandescription: The mediation team requested Mr. Edward Lekpeh to suggest the way forward since indeed he was responsible for the miss-understanding. In response, Mr. Lekpeh appealed to Mr. Gborzua to accept a new location because the second buyer had done more development on the spot due to the abandonment of the land by Mr. Gborzuah for a good period of time when he was away for problems as earlier mentioned. Mr. Gborzuah accepted the appeal and requested that Mr. Lekpeh identifies the new spot in the presence of the Ganta Community Forum leadership so that he will promptly hire a surveyor to determine the meets and bondsof the new spot. This request was accepted by Mr. Lekpeh and both are to work out the survey schedule and notify the Ganta Community Forum leadership to be present.
issuedescription:
The mediation committee of the Ganta Community Forum met with disputants in the above land dispute in Gbeislla town for two days-December 4 & 5, 2015 to resolve dispute arising from double sale of one spot. During the mediation, Mr. Lekpeh admitted selling land to Mrsess Gborzua and Paye but maintained that it was Mr. Paye that took his surveyor to the wrong spot. In counter argument, Paye informed the mediation team that Mr. Lekpeh described the site to him. And it was exactly the spot that he took the surveyors to.
The mediation team requested Mr. Edward Lekpeh to suggest the way forward since indeed he was responsible for the miss-understanding. In response, Mr. Lekpeh appealed to Mr. Gborzua to accept a new location because the second buyer had done more development on the spot due to the abandonment of the land by Mr. Gborzuah for a good period of time when he was away for problems as earlier mentioned. Mr. Gborzuah accepted the appeal and requested that Mr. Lekpeh identifies the new spot in the presence of the Ganta Community Forum leadership so that he will promptly hire a surveyor to determine the meets and bonds of the new spot. This request was accepted by Mr. Lekpeh and both are to work out the survey schedule and notify the Ganta Community Forum leadership to be present.
issuenotes: County surveyors should be invited to do the demarcation and Mr. Lekpeh be in readiness to give transfer deed to Mr. Gborzua.
statusnotes:
Nine years ago Mr. Edward Lekpeh sold one town lot of low land to Mr. Paye Gborzua in the Hope Village community in Ganta for $14,000LD.For the first three years, Mr. Gborzua lay a cannel to drain water from the land to enable him do garden. Due to some family problems he abandoned the area for some time. During Mr. Gborzua’s absence, Mr.Llekpeh sold the same lot to one Emmanuel Paye.Mr. Paye surveyed the land and planted corner stone bearing his name.
When Mr. Gborzua went to the site after addressing the family problem he was faced with, he surprisingly saw corner stones on his land bearing Mr. Emmanuel Paye’s name.  When contacted by Mr. Gborzua, Mr. Lekpeh   clarified that the second buyer, Mr. Paye did not take the surveyor to the rightful site but could not say whether Mr. Paye will be relocated or his money return. It was at this point that he decided to seek redress through the Ganta Community Forum.

updatedescription:
MLDL team members attended the second joint Suakoko DSC and the Sinyea CF meeting on 17 Nov. 2015. The forum prioritized four security issues and created an action plan for each. Highlights include:
 Town Boundary Dispute between Balama and Raymond: The mediation committee will address the dispute.

MLDL attended the second joint Kpai DSC and the Zoewienta CF meeting on 18 November 2015. The CF and DSC each held a separate meeting and prioritized four security concerns with an action plan. Highlights include:
A.
 Illegal burials: The DSC and CF intervention and mediation committees met with communities and ensured official burial sites were secured. Because no further illegal burials were discovered during the month, other local leaders are also attempting to secure official burial sites.
 Domestic violence: The CF intervention and mediation committees met with affected families to help restore peace and assisted in getting neglected children accepted back into their families.
 Nairobi flies causing outbreak of skin disease in the district: The matter was referred to the CSC for referral to the County Health Team.

 Nairobi flies causing outbreak of skin disease in the district: The matter was referred to the CSC for referral to the County Health Team.

resolution: Both the DSC & CF Mediation committee carryout a massive community awareness to have the issues resolved

disputant: Josiah Johnson Children vs Mendi Community
actionplandescription: DSC will convene meeting with each of the parties this month
updatedescription: DSC decided to elevate the issue to the Lofa CSC
issuedescription: The Former Paramount Chief Josiah Johnson's children are claiming to be the legitimate owners of the parcel of land issued by the former Lofa Superintendent, Galakpai Kortemai to the Mendi Community in Voinjama. This issue brought  a serious tension between the parties last month which subsequently reached the attention of the Voinjama DSC. The DSC decided in their December meeting to convene meeting with each of the parties earlier next year
issuenotes: We will do further inquiry with the Land Commissioner about this case this month.
statusnotes: The Former Paramount Chef Josiah Johnson's children are claiming to be the legitimate owners of the parcel of land issued by the former Lofa Superintendent, Galakpai Kortemai to the Mendi Community in Voinjama. This issue brought  a serious tension between the parties last month which subsequently reached the attention of the Voinjama DSC. The DSC decided in their December meeting to convene meeting with each of the parties earlier next year.
referralnote: The DSC attempted several times to address the issue but the parties did not show-up. Party 1 resides in Voinjama while party 2 resides in Monrovia. So it has been difficult for the DSC to bring these parties to a conference table

statusnotes: DSC decided to instruct TCs to regulate bush fire initiation  during this dry season

actionplandescription: CF decided to refer the case to the DSC in order to get an immediate redress
resolution: Government increased police presence in Zeayeama Clan, Zorzor District since the beginning of this year. There are six security officers assigned in that part of Zorzor now.
issuedescription: CF decided to refer the case to the DSC in order to get an immediate redress
issuename: Lack  of Police presence in Zeayeama Clan that host approximately 15000 people
statusnotes: This is a long time issue in Zeayeama Clan in Zorzor District. The  clan host about 15000 people whose security well-being is shouldered by only one police office. The concern clan has frequently suffered from violence and crimes whose perpetrators have most of the time escaped due to the lack of sufficient security presence to respond.

issuedescription:
Yarmein Administrative District is located high in the mountains of Nimba. Its citizens have over the years  cried for GSM and Radio signals in their area.
With the MLDL program being in Yarmein,the citizens have resolved to flag the issue  of lack of GSM and Radio signals in the area at every meeting of the DSC until resolution can be reached.
issuename: Lack of GSM coverage and Radio signal in greater part of Yarmein District
issuenotes: N/A
statusnotes:
Most parts  of Yarmein District are not covered by GSM signal and radio stations in Nimba County  do not cover Yarmein.
Yarmein has 18 towns with a total population  o about 26,000 people.

issuenotes:
How did  the disputants get  information  about the plan to meet with them on February 7 ?

statusnotes: Tis dispute has the potential to develop into a full scale violence if not addressed timely because it involves a former army general whose temperament is unpredictable.

issuedescription: The administrators at the Vayenglay clinic in Gbelay-Geh  Statutory District are allegedly involved in collecting fees from patients. It is a policy of GOL that all public clinics  in Liberia provide services free to patients.
issuename: Extortion of money from patients at Vayengly clinic
issuenotes:
Which health related NGO is supporting the Vayenglay clinic?
Is the District health officer aware of what is happening at the Vayenglay clinic?
Can the CF member who reported this substantiate the  allegation?
statusnotes: Illegal collection of  fees at public clinic in V aryenglay  is a serious concern that constitutes government corruption

issuedescription:
Garplay Community Forum members have observed over the past  few  months that authorities at the Yayenglay public clinic are involved in collecting fees from patients who go to the clinic for treatment against the policy of the ministry of Health and Social Welfare.
This was brought as a serious concern to the people of the district. This was referred to Gbelay-Geh DSC for prompt redress by Garplay CF.
issuename: Extortion of money from patients at Vayengly clinic
issuenotes:
Which health related NGO is supporting the Vayenglay clinic?
Is the District Health Officer aware of this happening?
statusnotes:
The administrators of Vayenglay clinic are allegedly involved  in collecting money from patients visiting the clinic for treatment.
GOL clinics are barred from collecting fees from patients.

actionplandescription:
The action plan committee has been mandated by DSC leadership to refer this issue to the CSC since it involves two distinct districts.
The committee will communicate the referral to the CSC before the end of February. Final report of resolution of  this issue will be given at the March 2016 meeting.
actionplannotes: PC will make follow up  on  the issue through phone calls and email to CSC secretariat in Sanniquellie.
issuedescription:
The people of Zorgowee and Peelar towns have for the last two years being in serious disagreement over the boundary that separates the two towns.Peelar people claim that Zorgowee farmers are in constant habit of  doing cross-boundary farming into their land. While Zorgowee refutes the claim.
This issue was brought to the attention of DSC by  Gbelay-Geh Commissioner, John Quato some times in  2015 but was not  prioritized at the that.
issuenotes:
Is it possible to find   copy of the Legislative Act that created the two districts?
Has it been tested at CSC level before?
What if the county surveyors were invited for re-demarcation of the district boundary?
statusnotes:
Gbelay-Geh DSC reported that from experience in the district, boundary disputes have always resulted into violent agitation.
Considering this experience and the dispute being between two administrative district of Nimba, it strongly feels that if not timely address, would pose serious threat to peace and security in the region(Gbelay-Geh and Yarpea-Mah Districts)

As the DSC has referred this dispute to the CSC,it is hopeful that the  CSC being the highest decision maker on security issues in the county will do every possible to resolve the impasse.

Gbelay-Geh Statutory District has 91 major towns  with an aggregated population of  over 69,000 people with limited police presence in only three  towns(Karnplay,Gborplay  and Loguatuo).
DSC requests the establishment of police depots in Garplay and Zualay towns in order to have geographical balance of police presence in the district.

disputant: Menquellen & Kpatawee Clan( Sanoyea & Suakoko District)
actionplancommittee: Both Saukoko DSC & B-CSC Mediation and Intervention Committee.
actionplandescription: The committee will meet with all disputant/ parties on the above date mention to start mediation process as soon as possible.
actionplannotes: MLDL should support and guide the mediation process because the dispute is highly political. past county leadership give hope to either of the parties to be the rightful owner of the disputed waterfall.
resolution: Both the CSC & Suakoko DSC met the two district & clan citizens on April 5 2016 to settle the Kpartawee waterfall issue as of now the two clan and Districts citizens are working together to manage the waterfall.
issuedescription: The issue was refer to the Bong CSC mediation and Intervention committee will  travel to Suakoko and Sanoyea (Menquelleh & Kpatawee Clan) to start mediation process for the boundary land disputes between the two districts & Clan for possible resolution on March 19,2016.
issuenotes:
1.What is the mean or root cause of this conflict? Is it about the benefit generated from the waterfall?

2. How the dispute started? 3. what are the Government authorities involve? 4. what can be done to put the dispute to rest/ Way forward?
5. what are the disputing parties claims
statusnotes: The disputes is about a waterfall that is location between the two district Suakoko & Sanoyea ( Kpatawee & Menquellen Clan) this dispute is about 15 years old. with both clan claiming ownership of the waterfall causing investor to backup from carrying on any development. According to the citizens two years ago one person was kill as a result of the dispute when violence broke among citizens as to  who own the waterfall. The Kpatawee waterfall is a history site that young people and others spend holiday and weekend.

statusnotes: There is no city or Magistrate court across the district causing serious breakdown of alaw and order leading to criminal activities.

actionplancommittee: Zorzor DSC, Konia CF & MLDL Staff members.
actionplandescription: Setup a special mediation committee comprising of Zorzor DSC, Konia CF and MLDL to mediate the case | Mar. 2 - 7, 2016.
resolution: The Zorzor DSC in collaboration with the district authorities intervened in the dispute and amicably resolved. Mohammend waived his claim against Borkeza citizens thereby putting an end to the entire issue.
updatedescription: First conference was held and settlement options were generated but no agreement has be reached.
issuedescription: One Mohammed vs chiefs/elders of Borkeza are in serious misunderstanding over the ownership of the lease money (USD 2000) given to the citizens of Borkeza for the construction of the Cellcom Tower in their home. Mohammed's cocoa garden happens to be the site that was selected by the citizens of Borkeza for the tower construction. Against that background, he (Mohammed) is claiming that the lease money should be for him exclusively while the town authorities are likewise claiming that the money is exclusively for the town.

actionplandescription: Fire control awareness was made on the media and regulation messages were sent to all TCs for onward dissemination | Jan. 15 -  Feb. 21, 2016.

actionplandescription: Zorzor DSC will elevate this case to the Lofa CSC and at the same time counsel the parents of the deceased | Mar. 1 - 28, 2016
updatedescription: Zorzor DSC elevated this issue to the CSC but no action has been taken by them as at date. The family of the decease is claiming that foul play may have occurred and that could possibly be the reason why nothing is being done about their case. Something needs to be done as soon as possible.
issuedescription: Sienneh Gayflor was alleged murdered in 2015 by her boyfriend in Zorzor City, Zorzor District. Since the incident, the alleged murderer escaped to Guinea and has not been brought to justice by Liberians and Guineans security actors. The deceased's family and the general public is unhappy about the prolonged delay in the administration of justice in said case, and this is putting the district at a brink of imminent violence.

actionplancommittee: Konia CF Mediation Committee [Krubo Mulbah, Tarnue Gbelee & Bigman Harris]
actionplandescription: Follow up and mediation conference will be held to resolve the dispute | Feb. 20 - 28, 2016
resolution: Fissebu Citizens did intervene in the dispute b/w the Lorma woman and the Mandingo residents. In an effort to resolve the issue, the lorma waman was relocated to while the Mandingo were given go ahead to continue with their grave yard ownership. The issue is now resolved.
updatedescription: First conference was held but no amicable resolution was reached. Arrangements are ongoing for second conference
issuedescription: A Lorma woman is attempting to carry on house construction on the graveyard of the Mandingo people. The Mandingo people are opposing said construction which has created chaos among them.

actionplancommittee: Zorzor City Mayor, Zorzor Paramount Chief & Seleke Komala
actionplandescription: Fire control awareness and regulations will be made on the community radio station for one week | Feb. 15 - 21, 2016
resolution: Fire control awareness and regulations have been put into place and fire incidents have subsided - largely due to the presence of rain.
issuedescription: Several fire incidents have occurred in Zorzor District and left the entire district in a state of fear.

actionplancommittee: Joint Zorzor DSC & Konia CF Mediation Committee
actionplandescription: A fact finding team will be sent to Fissebu to gather information on the case; mediation conference will be held thereafter | Feb. 12 - 28, 2016
resolution: Konia CF Mediation Committee worked with the traditional authorities of Fissebu to discuss the sticky issues that kept parties in chaos. Those issues were handled and the matter is now resolved. Issue got resolved since March 2016 but resolution got reported this month.
updatedescription: First conference schedule coincided with a death situation in Fissebu which impeded the holding of the conference; Arrangements are ongoing for another conference.
issuedescription: The landlord of Fissebu gave a parcel of land to the church people for the construction of their church but later took back said land for reasons not disclosed - thereby erupting tension between the church and the town elders.

actionplandescription: Conduct public awareness on the media; pass on fire control and regulation messages | Feb. - Apr. 2016
resolution: Fire control awareness and regulations have been put into place and fire incidents have subsided - largely due to the presence of rain.
issuedescription: Five fire incidents have occurred in four districts in Lofa County leaving several properties and crops completely destroyed.

actionplandescription: Gas Sellers Association of Voinjama will be invited for a meeting with LNFS  and CSC Leadership | Mar. 1 - Apr. 30, 2016
updatedescription:
Gas Sellers Association has been invited several times but they are yet to show up for meeting. LNFS will take a reasonable action against them that will warrant them showing up for the much needed meeting.

LNFS should institute the usage of fire extinguisher to all gas selling points in Voinjama and do more fire preventive awareness.
issuedescription: Imminent fire disaster is looming over Voinjama City in connection with the rampant illegal selling of gasoline in the City of Voinjama.

actionplandescription: DEA will follow up on the two culprits to ensure that they face trial.
resolution: The two culprits have faced trial and were guilty; they are currently serving their jail sentences
issuedescription: DEA recently arrested two persons (George Sakama and Lassana Fofana) in illegal possession of narcotic drugs. They were charged and put behand bar to await trial.

actionplandescription: Proposed resolution timeline will be drown for endorsement by the CSC Leadership; MLDL and the parties will be communicated to about the proposed resolution timeline | Apr. 23, 2016
updatedescription: Proposed resolution timeline has been drawn and endorsed; communication have not been sent to MLDL and the parties.

issuename: Telemu an AG Church doctrinal dispute

actionplandescription: Search and raid those hideouts ASAP
resolution: Security actors carried out raiding in Foya City; some drugs were arrested but suspects escaped. Since the raiding, stealing has subsided and things are now calm.
updatedescription: The hideouts were searched and identified; currently under surveillance for raiding.
issuedescription: Criminals have regrouped and established a new criminal hideout on Kpormbu Road in Foya City. As a result of this establishment, the crime rate has increased and community dwellers are currently living in fear.
issuename: Criminal hideout in Kpormbu Road, Foya

actionplandescription: Solicit support for victims ASAP
updatedescription: Large leadership meeting was held to solicit support for the fire victims; pledges and promises were made but no assistance has been extended to the victims.
issuedescription: Fire spread from a charcoal mining spot into a savanna grass and subsequently extended into three towns and an FDA tree plantation and eventually destroyed the whole plantation as well as the three towns.

resolution: Subsequent to intervention by the DEA, checkpoint was removed, fear was alleviated and flow of movement was resumed.

The CF member from that region says the establishment of the checkpoint has created panic and is impeding movement of people due to screening they undergo when ever they use said route to get to other communities.
issuename: Fear because of checkpoint in Kpaku's Town

resolution: Early warning and response messages were disseminated in all towns and villages; control mechanism has been put into place and issue is now resolved.

resolution: Meeting was held and dispute issue resolved; calm has resumed.

issuename: Mob violence after fire in Kolliemai
statusnotes: There was a threat to hurt a man who started the fire.

resolution: Zorzor DSC in collaboration with the Lofa CSC met and discussed citizens concerns with the hospital administration. The hospital has resolve on adhering to the plight of the people thus resolving the issue. Resolution conference was held in March 2016.
updatedescription: Referral was not done; instead, DSC had meeting with the hospital authorities and efforts are on the way to resolve the sticky issues.

resolution: Giziboigai chiefs and elders pursue the issue nearly six months ago but the perpetrator escaped to Guinea thereby bringing the threat to an end.
updatedescription: Konia CF elevated the case to the DSC; the perpetrator escaped to Guinea a month and a half ago. Since his escape, situations are relatively calm and BIN Officers have even been deployed in that part of the district. Currently, the situation appears to be resolved.

The names of the two parties (husband and wife) were not disclosed. The violence occurred in a community called Giziboigai.
statusnotes: A man threatened to kill his wife or burn the town.

resolution: The culprit was arrested and transferred to Voinjama Central Prison; culprit is currently behind bar awaiting trial.
issuedescription: A man known as Fayia has engaged in collecting money from communities within Zeayemai Clan, Zorzor District, under the pretext of registering them for relief items. Before the situation claimed the attention of the Konia CF, Fayia had already collected $10500 Liberian Dollars from 7 communities within Zeayeamai Clan, with each paying $1500 as registration fees.

issuedescription: Bu-Yao DSC reported that the road linking Bahn and Butuo is in a deplorable condition. It stressed that if nothing is done about the road before the rain sets in, goods and services will denied the people of the entire district  thereby leading to starvation and sicknesses.
issuename: Bad road between Bahn and Butou
statusnotes: As the rain draws nearer, citizens and commuters on the Bahn-Butuo road are worried about difficulties they will phase  if nothing is done about reconditioning said road before the rain sets in by June or July.

actionplancommittee: The B-DSC intervention Committee will ensure that this issue is elevated to the CSC promptly.
actionplandescription: The plan of action is that the DSC has referred this issue to the CSC with recommendation that the Nimba County Health Team helps to repair the ambulance.
issuedescription:
Butuo Clinic had since been  elevated to Health Centre status and its patient intake has increased immensely but lacks means of transferring critical patients to the Zoe-Geh Medical Centre in New Glalay town.
The UNDP donated ambulance is down mechanically, no money to repair it.
issuename: Lack of ambulance  at Butuo Health Center

actionplandescription: This issue has been referred to the CSC with the recommendation that it contact a GSM company and offer options for entry into the District by next month.
actionplannotes: PC will follow-up with CSC to get feedback on negotiation with GSM company.  PC will follow-up with DSC an CF committee members selected for acquiring land at community level.  If these options do not work, we will compile a list of people who can use phones to present data to entice company.  We could also organize a rally to bring phones and demonstrate to GSM representatives the potential for business.
issuedescription: Despite GSM entering Grand Gedeh County 10 years ago, no GSM company or tower has reached Gbao District.  It is recommended that the CSC liaises with a GSM company in Grand Gedeh as the people of Gbao are willing to donate free land for the construction of the towers in 3 locations.  Gbao is very isolated from the rest of the county.
issuenotes: Is Gbao District a viable location for GSM?  Are the citizens prepared to provide land?  Has the CSC sent feedback to the DSC about contacting the GSM company.
statusnotes: GSM companies reached Grand Gedeh in 2006. They expanded to a few urban centers in 2010.

actionplandescription: Arrest and impound vehicle of such category | Mar. 18 - Apr. 30, 2016
resolution: Police Officers instituted measures to calm down thereat emulating from such issue. Currently, there are no vehicle plying the streets of Voinjama or Lofa without plate or with tented glasses.
updatedescription: General vehicle inspection is currently ongoing within the county; even vehicles with old license plates will be arrested and impounded.

actionplandescription: Conduct public awareness on the media; pass on fire control and regulation messages | Feb. - Apr. 2016
resolution: Fire control awareness and regulations have been put into place and fire incidents have subsided, largely due to the presence of rain.
issuedescription: Five fire incidents occurred in several communities in Lofa County in the month of March alone. Several properties got damaged during those incidents. In one of those five reported incidents, a 36-yr old woman suffered from first degree burnt, and is currently in a critical condition and admitted at the Telewoyan Hospital in Voinjama.

actionplandescription: The CSC through the BIN will follow up with the investigation of the 3 culprits and the well being of the 25 children at the Safe Home in Kakata | ASAP
resolution: The 25 trafficked children have been brought back to Lofa from Kakata and   safely delivered to their respective parents. The culprits are still in Monrovia undergoing further investigation. But as it stands, this issue can now be call a resolved case.
updatedescription: Central government has put announcement on the radio for parents of the 25 children to go to Kakata to sign and take delivery of their children; the 3 culprits are still undergoing investigation in Monrovia.
issuedescription: Three Liberians hailing from Kolahun District allegedly took 25 children, 20 of whom are under the age 18yrs and the balance 5 between the ages 18yrs and 25yrs. Guinean security authorities arrested all of them in late February and immediately deported them to Liberia through the Konadu Border in Voinjama District, Lofa County. Upon their deportation back to Liberia, security actors further transferred the 20 trafficking victims to the save home run by Save the Children in Kakata, and also referred the 3 culprits to Monrovia for further investigation.

actionplandescription: DSC  intervention committee goes for assessment and report in next meeting.
issuedescription: Lack of save drinking water in Gbayea Town.
statusnotes: After the 14 years civil war in Liberia ,lots of INGOs and NGO came to the aid of people in local communities by building hand pumps that helped them.But now most of the NGOs have left the communities ,and most of the hand pumps are now down thus causing lack of drinking water.

actionplancommittee: The mediation and intervention committees members will address this issue.

issuedescription: There are lot of people within the community selling illicit drugs and the youth in the community are taking in these drugs on a daily basis in B'hai district.

actionplandescription: A follow up will be made to the County Land Surveyor for immediate redress before situation gets off hand | Apr.18 - 30, 2016
updatedescription: The Resident County Land Surveyor has issued some of the outstanding deeds to the would be disputants. Only few deeds are currently outstanding. That means, much has been done to address future dispute.
issuedescription: Several Foya land owners land title deeds remained in the possession of the county land surveyor and got damaged during the fire disaster on the county administration building in Voinjama . As a result of that  incident, there is an imminent proliferation of land disputes in Foya City.

actionplancommittee: Shelloe CF Leadership & Foya DSC Intervention Committee
actionplandescription: Shelloe CF will liaise with Foya DSC Intervention Committee to investigate the cause of death | Apr. 14 - May 4, 2016
resolution: The uncertainty surrounding the dead body has been quelled with the examinations and burial.
issuedescription: A 35-yr old woman belonging to the Kissi Tribal Group known  as Abe McCarthy was found dead on Kpormbu Road in Foya City. Circumstances surrounding her death are not known. After her death, Global Community and other medical actors collected the body and did several examinations in order to establish whether there was foul play. But all those results read negative. With such result, she has since been buried.

actionplancommittee: Voinjama DSC Intervention Committee & Local Authorities
actionplandescription: Town Chiefs (TCs) should be instructed to search and identify criminal hideouts within their communities for possible raiding | Apr. 14 - May 15, 2016
resolution: DSC instructed town chiefs of all towns within Voinjama District to increase surveillance on criminal hideouts in their communities and to report any form of in security that may arise. Since the passage of the instruction, things are calm and smooth.
issuedescription: Criminals have engaged in establishing new hideouts in makeshifts and old & abandoned houses in several towns and villages in Voinjama District. As a result of these establishments, the crime rate has sharply increased thereby leading to panic and fear in many towns and villages.

actionplancommittee: Voinjama DSC Mediation Committee & Local Authorities
actionplandescription: Early warning and early response awareness will be made on the radio; under age children will be banned on such activities in all towns and villages | Apr. 15 - May 15, 2016
resolution: DSC and CF jointly made awareness on the radio on the issue prior to the end of plum season. Additionally, they banned under age children from climbing plum trees. That eventually brought the issue under total conttrol.
issuedescription: Several accidents leading to children's hands and legs getting broken as a result of climbing and falling from plum trees has claimed the attention of many parents in Voinjama District.

actionplandescription: Lawalazu CF will elevate this case to Voinjama DSC.
resolution: DSC mandated citizens of David Selma Ta to convene a general town meeting to discuss the issue of hiding aliens in their community. That meeting was held and an agreement was reach for no alien to be hidden in the the town from now onward. BIN has eventually been welcomed to come in and register aliens currently residing in the town.
issuedescription: Community dwellers or residents have engaged in conceiving or hiding illegal strangers/aliens from local authorities and BIN Officers in David - Selma Town, Voinjama District. They are doing so for their personal gains without considering the risk it posses to the general or larger society. There is a general history of aliens often times committing crimes - such as rape and murder and escaping to Guinea.
issuename: Hiding illegal aliens in David-Selma Town

actionplandescription: Zorzor DSC will communicate with the DHO for border surveillance to be tightened and for washing hand protocol to be reinforced |  Apr. 15 - 26, 2016
resolution: The DSC worked with the district health team to tighten border surveillance until news of the ebola situation in Guinea subsided. IOM even deployed border monitoring team at most of the border points in Zorzor District until situation finally subsided. Right now, the issue is declared resolved.
updatedescription: Border surveillance has been tightened and handwashing protocol has also been reinforced at various crossing points.
issuedescription: Fear has grasped residents of Zorzor District as a result of the new outbreak of ebola in Guinea. Credible information received says that 7 new ebola confirmed cases have been registered in neighbouring Guinea in communities along the borderline with Liberia.

actionplandescription: Invite the County Attorney to explain the roles, functions and limitations of various sectors of government and traditional groups when managing cases in the district | Apr. 20 - 26, 2016
updatedescription: The DSC in collaboration with the district authorities invited all chiefs and elders of Zorzor District to a consultative meeting - which will enable them to address the issue of overlapping and enhance grater collaboration among local authorities.
issuedescription: A boy commonly called Junior Boy allegedly broke traditional laws of Fissebu, thereby causing local leaders of Fissebu imposing find against him for immediate payment. Instead of paying the find, he rather took the case/matter to the Zorzor Magisterial Count in Zorzor for redressed. When the court magistrate summoned the parties, local authorities of Zorzor went along to withdraw the case for home settlement since the case had traditional implication. But the complainer and the magistrate refused and that refusal erupted tension among authorities of Zorzor District.
issuename: Zorzor conflict between judiciary and traditional leaders

actionplandescription: Konia CF will elevate this case to the Zorzor DSC | Apr. 20 - 30, 2016
resolution: The CF elevated the issue to the DSC in April. Upon receiving the issue immediately passed an ultimatum to the youths of Zelemai and Kelewu to refrain from public smoking or could be arrested and prosecuted. Since then, public smoking has stop in the two towns.
updatedescription: Zorzor DSC Intervention Committee has not made any arrests but has warned those involved to immediately refrain.
issuedescription: The youths of Zelemai and Kelewu have engaged in public smoking of marijuana in open areas or places. Community residents are complaining that the happenings is polluting the community and influencing underage children to engage in same or similar practices - which is not healthy for the general society.
issuename: Public marijuana smoking in Zelemai and Kelewu

actionplandescription: Civilians and security actors to be on top security alert; report any strange security situation ASAP | Apr. 22 - Jul. 30, 2016
resolution: The rumors spread in April 2016 but since then there has been no scaring issue experience.On that note, we can conclude that things are calm and the rumors may have no relevance.
issuedescription: There is a rumours of terrorists attack on Lofa which has claimed the attention of security actors and led to tightening security in the county.

actionplancommittee: No committee yet.  Will decide in May.
actionplandescription: No plan yet.  Will decide in May.
resolution: Talk show was held and quality sensitization was made against the issue. Live deprivation cases have reduced thereby putting the issue under control.
issuedescription: There is a sharp increase in the number of life deprivation (suicide) cases in Lofa County. In time past, domestic violence cases were topping the list of cases across the county, but in recent time life deprivation cases have taken over recording a total of 9 across Lofa just in between March 18 and April 22, 2016. Fear has grasped many communities, especially the communities in which those incidents have occurred.

actionplandescription: Guinean border authorities will be contacted for conference ASAP
updatedescription: The issue is currently before the CSC for intervention. But not much have been done to resolve the issue. We are hoping progress can be made between now and August.
issuedescription: Guinean Border Authorities have continuously refused or denied Liberians  Border Authorities share access and control of the Makona River. This issue has been going on for long now and tension keeps building up.  If nothing is done about it now, there is a risk of situation going off hands. Note: Guineans are claiming that the river is exclusively for them, and against that background, they cannot share access and control with Liberia.
issuename: Security officials' dispute regarding Makona River

actionplancommittee: •That GOL constructs a road along the border to serve as a visibility sign for the boundary
actionplandescription: That GOL constructs a road along the border to serve as a visibility sign for the boundary
issuedescription: The over 200 km boundary lacks visibility, it has no natural indicator of boundary demarcation such as a river, a mountain or valley, etc…Neither does it  have artificial signposts to show the boundary; it is isolated and very remote in a dense forest where there is scarcely any human habitation. The boundary is only connected with a few settlements sometimes distant one another of 30 km. it is also home to many beasts (tigers, lions anacondas, etc... In reality, it is host to many dangerous animals that further exacerbate the terror making it fearful to humans to explore it without sophisticated weapons.

actionplancommittee: Esablisted a twelve member committee to draft a policy concerning flammable substances ( BIN,LNP, CIty Mayor, MLDL PM, AA, Protocol, BNP, NFS etc)
actionplandescription: Esablisted a twelve member committee to draft a policy concerning flammable substances ( BIN,LNP, CIty Mayor, MLDL PM, AA, Protocol, BNP, NFS etc)
issuedescription: Gasoline, fuel and kerosene are sold all over in Liberia in a very informal way. But this form of sale has a lot of hazard causing death or permanent disability. These flammable products are sold mostly by individuals as business or trade and it constitutes a form of employment for thousands of youths. The issue is how to reconcile between informal employment and the death hazard posed by flammable substance.
statusnotes: Gasoline, fuel and kerosene are sold all over in Liberia in a very informal way. But this form of sale has a lot of hazard causing death or permanent disability. These flammable products are sold mostly by individuals as business or trade and it constitutes a form of employment for thousands of youths. The issue is how to reconcile between informal employment and the death hazard posed by flammable substance.

issuedescription: Narcotic are all over the place in Grand Gedeh and it has become a consummate business and hobby for the youth. The LEW do their best to arrest trafficants and abusers of narcotics. Meanwhile it seems that the trade and abuse of narcotics is rather increasing than abating because of one fact. Drugs abuse or trafficking are bailable offences. This really frustrates the efforts of LEW and the ordinary citizens.
issuename: Proliferation of narcotics in Grand Gedeh

Mr. Boo,according to CF members from Camp 4,is demanding resettlement benefits from FDA before he can relocate himself
.His claim is against the back ground that he and his family have lived on the land for over 30 years before GOL demarcation exercise.As such, he feels as a citizen,shouldn't  be thrown away in such a manner.

actionplancommittee: The CSC Intervention Committee along with the Carter Center
actionplandescription: The CSC Intervention Committee along with the Carter Center and UNMIL will do an independent investigation in the case and provide finding in next meeting
mediationoutcome: Outcome will be available during June meeting
issuedescription: On Friday, May 20, 2016, Dorbor Kollie had a motorbike accident and became traumatized. Following the accident, he walked into the neighborhood and damaged the cooking materials of another man’s wife. That resulted to a fight between Dorbor Kollie and the woman husband. While fighting, Police Officer Gayflor Tarnue went to intervene and eventually discovered that Dorbor Kollie had an accident prior to the fight. Based on his discovery, he decided to arrest Dorbor Kollie and his bike and take them to the Police Station. But Dorbor Kollie resisted and because of his refusal, the officer allegedly beat him until he became helpless. Thereafter, he was taken to Tellewoyan Hospital where he died at the close of the day. Investigations are currently ongoing to establish the actual cause of his death.
issuename: Violence resulting to lose of life
statusnotes: Investigation ongoing

issuedescription: Since 2006 the GSM communication extended communication to Grand Gedeh, the communication company has not been able to expand to Gbao district; the locals in the district stand up hills and trees to get small network coverage from far to reach network areas.
issuenotes: Since there is no GSM company, what you think should be done. And how do you communicate with your family/families members far and near?
statusnotes: Gbao district in Grand Gedeh County has no GSM company to provide network coverage:  the locals of Gbao district have no means of communicating with security personnel during emergency or to call any part of the world.  The district is in the middle of two others districts (B’hai and Gboe-Ploe) Gbao has the estimated population of 19,000; the locals have to stand on top of hills and trees to access network coverage. The entire district is lacking development; limited Safe drinking water, bad roads, limited medicine at various clinics, no network coverage etc.

actionplandescription: Referral will be made to Foya DSC | June 10, 2016
actionplannotes: The issue is highly political - the leadership of the district seems not to be in favor of the person wanting to do the project
issuedescription: Kpaikio Quarter in Foya City is a community that experiences flood during the raining season every year. The area regularly gets flooded because of the blockage of the water way. In recent time the Muslim within Foya wrote the political group called "Friends of Kpakai" to assist in constructing a culvert that will alleviate the regular flooding and suffering that come with it. Friends of Kpakai in return wrote the City Mayor Office to obtain permit and to solicit their support. The City Mayor Office with no delay also gave Friends of Kpakai the go ahead to do the culvert project. As the project was about to kick off, the Statutory Superintendent issued a stop order on grounds that his office, the county resident engineer office and the county superintendent office were not approached, and some technical aspects have not been taken into consideration. The Statututary Superintendent action of stopping the project has created a divide in views and opinions of the people in the district and subsequently  leading to tension among district residents.
issuename: The halting of culvert construction at Kpaikio Quarter, Foya City
issuenotes: Has the issue been elevated or referred to the upper structures? If yes,  what has changed?
statusnotes: Awaiting referral to the DSC or CSC

disputant: Total Gas Station & Dream Food Center vs Security Actors
actionplandescription: Voinjama DSC will elevated the issue to the Lofa CSC | June 17, 2016
issuedescription: Dream Food Center and Total Gas Station are situated along each other in Voinjama City. Total is in flammable goods sale while Dream is in Food and drinks sale. Dream uses fire, particularly in open areas, to prepare her food. There is a huge fear that some day the fire may spread or cross over to Total and lead to serious disaster. The DSC Leadership met with Dream Management to figure ways to fix the situation but Dream is claiming that Total met them on the ground and so they should have known better. The situation is at a stand still and the risk remains unchanged.
issuename: Fear of imminent fire disaster in connection with the proximity of Total Gas Station and Dream Food Center in Voinjama City
statusnotes: Situation awaiting CSC intervention

issuedescription: Tellewoyan Memorial Hospital is the only government referral hospital in Lofa County. Sometime the hospital can go without current for a day or two - during which time no significant work can be done at the hospital. Recently, a patient died under surgery as a result of abrupt lost of power (current).

actionplandescription: CSC will closely monitor the trial of Charles Morlu alias Tea Spoon | Jun - Jul. 2016
issuedescription: Charles Morlu alias Tea Spoon is a notorious criminal who has record of stealing valuable items in Lofa, Bong and Ninba Counties. He was recently arrested and turned over to the 10 Judicial Circuit Court in Voinjama for persecution. Tt is allege that when security actors were taking statement from him (Tea Spoon), he revealed that he had been in close connection with the Lofa County Police Commander and the County Attorney of Lofa County. According to the CSOs representative on the CSC, Tea Spoon is alleging that most of the missions he goes on, he reports or turnover the stolen items to the LNP county commander and the county attorney. This allegation, if proven, will undermined the public trust and confidence in security and law enforcement actors and will subsequently damage the image of the County Attorney and the Police Commander. The public is very concern and every one is focus on the outcome of this case.
issuename: The arrest of a notorious criminal - Charles Morlu alias Tea Spoon)
statusnotes: Issue awaiting CSC monitoring

actionplancommittee: NCSC Intervention committee members(Morris Teamah,Reginald Mehn,Oquewon Gono) and Gbelay-Geh District local authorities
actionplandescription: In the June CSC meeting, NSA reported that since the intervention of the county security council through the local authorizes of Gbelay-Geh District, series of meetings had taken place between the local leaders of the   area on both sides which resulted into the abolition of the mid-night cocoa trade along the borders.
issuedescription:
CSC-1:
In May, NSA reported mid night trade in Cocoa at the Liberian-Ivorian border near the port of Loguatuo.CSC resolved at the time to address this concern locally.
In the June CSC meeting, NSA reported that since the intervention of the county security council through the local authorizes of Gbelay-Geh District, series of meetings had taken place between the local leaders of the   area on both sides which resulted into the abolition of the mid-night cocoa trade along the borders.
issuename: Illgal mid-night Cocoa trade at Ivorian border
statusnotes: The issue of illegal midnight  cocoa trade at Ivorian border has been resolved by NCS collaboration with local authorities in Gbelay-Geh District.

actionplancommittee: County Inspector Reginald Mehn and BIN deputy commander George Woyou
actionplandescription: The CSC, in its June 20 meeting, instructed the county inspector and BIN deputy commander to visit Gborplay on June 24, 2016 to investigate the issue and make appropriate recommendations to the CSC for resolution. The committee report will be presented at the July 18 meeting in Sanniquellie.
issuedescription:
Gbelay-Geh DSC
The Paramount Chief of Gborplay Chiefdom, Mr. Isaac Duo reported to Gbelay-Geh DSC that BIN personnel assigned in Gborplay port of entry are in the habit of harassing (extortion of money and temporary detention) Ivorian citizens who come to Liberia to transact business and to visit relatives. This act on the part of the BIN has given ground for reprisal by Ivorian security against Liberians travelling to Ivory Coast.
The chief appealed to the DSC to intervene in order to improve the fragile security relationship that has ensured as a result of the BIN behavior.
Chief Duo further revealed that attempts to seek redress from BIN commander in Loguatou have failed because the officers involved are said to be under instruction from Sanniquellie and not the commander in the district. This prompted the Gbelay-Geh DSC to elevate the issue to CSC in Sanniquellie since the BIN personnel in Gborplay are under direct supervision of BIN county commander who himself is a member of the CSC.
The CSC, in its June 20 meeting, instructed the county inspector and BIN deputy commander to visit Gborplay on June 24, 2016 to investigate the issue and make appropriate recommendations to the CSC for resolution. The committee’s report will be presented at the July 18 meeting in Sanniquellie
issuename: Harassment of Ivorian business people by BIN personnel
statusnotes: The issue of BIN harassment in Gborplay  has been resolved by NCSC following  referral to it by GG-DSC.

actionplancommittee: At the June 20 meeting in Sanniquellie,the CSC constituted  a multi-Sectorial  committee  comprising of MIA,LRA,DEA,LNP,Traditional Council(TC) and BIN.
actionplandescription:
In the wake of continued smuggling of goods ,especially motor bikes into Liberia through unofficial entry points as reported by LRA at the June 20 meeting in Sanniquellie,the CSC constituted  a multi-Sectorial  committee  comprising of MIA,LRA,DEA,LNP,Traditional Council(TC) and BIN to  assess the border line with Guinea  near Ganta and recommend measures that   could control smuggling  of goods in the Ganta area. The committee is required to submit its report to the leadership of the CSC two weeks before the next CSC meeting in July.
It is estimated that over 25 motor cycles enter Liberian through illegal means weekly.
issuedescription:
LRA:
Liberia Revenue Authority (LRA) representative on the CSC reported in the June 20 meeting in Sanniquellie that deputy DEA director for Nimba County (Kenemon) used GOL assigned vehicle to transport 62 cartons of outdated 10% alcoholic beverage into Liberia through Ganta port of entry. He used his official position to intimidate security forces assigned at the gate thereby evading government taxes for personal benefits. He has been placed under suspension by the county commander, Col. Julius Kannebah and the goods confiscated by LRA until the business man he was fronting for pays the appropriate taxes to GOL. 
The fate of deputy DEA county commander is still unclear; however, the CSC resolved to recommend to DEA authorities in Monrovia the indefinite suspension of the officer without pay.
In the wake of continued smuggling of goods ,especially motor bikes into Liberia through unofficial entry points as reported by LRA at the June 20 meeting in Sanniquellie,the CSC constituted  a multi-Sectorial  committee  comprising of MIA,LRA,DEA,LNP,Traditional Council(TC) and BIN to  assess the border line with Guinea  near Ganta and recommend measures that   could control smuggling  of goods in the Ganta area. The committee is required to submit its report to the leadership of the CSC two weeks before the next CSC meeting in July.
It is estimated that over 25 motor cycles enter Liberian through illegal means weekly.

issuedescription:
DEA:
The county commander of DEA, Col. Julius Kannebah reported that Police has arrested 40 cartons of outdated medical drugs on a truck travelling from Guinea to Liberia through Ganta port.
LNP accused LRA of not properly checking the truck at the border. Police is suspicious of LRA.  This situation is building tension between the two government institutions. 
The CSC has resolved to address the issue by setting up a committee to investigate the incident. The Committee comprises of BIN, NSA and LRA. The committee will report at the July meeting in Sanniquellie

actionplancommittee:
Augustine Gbarlea-LNP
Jefferson Gokor -Commissioner
Wallace Zegbuo
Wilson Sokpahson
actionplandescription:
In an effort to address this issue, the Wee-Gbeyi DSC convened an emergency meeting in Gbanquoi on June 7, 2016.The following actions were taken during the meeting.
1.	LNP cone originally situated near Saclepea on the Ganta-Saclepea highway was relocated near Weh Creek to serve as deterrent to  criminals
2.	All activities of car washing, sand mining and  coal burning have been ordered halted by the LNP
3.	Regular night patrol was launched since June 7, 2014.
4.	W-DSC agrees to solicit support from GOL and donor partners to break down the tick forest around the Wehla creek which is believed to be hideouts of the criminals.
issuedescription:
W-DSC-1:
In previous meetings, Fleedin Community Forum referred to Wee-Gbeyi DSC the use of Weh creek as criminal hideouts; where drugs users and dealers reside under the impression of being car or motor bike washers, coal burners or sand miners. They sometimes hijack personal effects of peaceful citizens who live around the Wehla Community
issuename: Criminals hideout at Weh Creek in Saclepea City

actionplancommittee: Paramount chief Morgan Sonyah,Elder David Gee and Jefferson Kwei
actionplandescription:
olice intelligence has been deployed in the district to effect the arrest since June 24.
Outcomes of this most vigorous approach will be reported by the police in the July 18 CSC meeting in Sanniquellie
issuedescription:
CSC:
In the May CSC meeting the newly appointed county attorney for Nimba, Cllr. Adolphus   Karduah was mandated by the CSC to re- institute a legal process that will lead to re-examination of the Butuo murder case involving Stephen whose last name is to be identified. Stephen was allegedly released from detention through the influence of Law Maker, Sam Kogar of district #5, Nimba County.
Attorney Kanduah reported in the June meeting that police had made several trips to Kpaiblee District where Stephen is said to be living but mistakenly arrested a man who was later proven not to be the accused.
The CSC therefore requested local chiefs in the district and the community watch forum to assist police in order to bring Stephen to justice.
Paramount Morgan Sonyah, Chief Elder David Gee,Dubuzon CF Secretary, Jefferson Kwei  were invited by police on June 23,2016  to assist with the process.
Police intelligence has been deployed in the district to effect the arrest since June 24.
Outcomes of this most vigorous approach will be reported by the police in the July 18 CSC meeting in Sanniquellie.
issuename: Butuo murder suspect on the run in Kpaiblee District

Adolphus   Karduah was mandated by the CSC to re- institute a legal process that will lead to re-examination of the Butuo murder case involving Stephen whose last name is to be identified. Stephen was allegedly released from detention through the influence of Law Maker, Sam Kogar of district #5, Nimba County.
Attorney Kanduah reported in the June meeting that police had made several trips to Kpaiblee District where Stephen is said to be living but mistakenly arrested a man who was later proven not to be the accused.
The CSC therefore requested local chiefs in the district and the community watch forum to assist police in order to bring Stephen to justice.
Paramount Morgan Sonyah, Chief Elder David Gee,Dubuzon CF Secretary, Jefferson Kwei  were invited by police on June 23,2016  to assist with the process.
Police intelligence has been deployed in the district to effect the arrest since June 24.
Outcomes of this most vigorous approach will be reported by the police in the July 18 CSC meeting in Sanniquellie.
issuename: Butuo murder suspect on the run in Kpaiblee District

actionplandescription:
Actions taken by the CSC to address the issue included but not limited to:
1.	Mandated CWF county chairman, Mr. Stanley Vonzeah to launch a massive awareness campaign on the roles and responsibilities of the CWF personnel in the county.
2.	Re-vet the CWF membership with the full involvement of local leaders to include youth & women leaders’ town, clan and paramount chiefs.
3.	Report CWF members involved to police for prosecution.
issuedescription:
The issue of Community Watch Forum (CWF) playing the role of both police and judge in towns and villages in Yarmein District as referred to the CSC by Y-DSC during May meeting, was discussed in the June 18 CSC meeting.
Actions taken by the CSC to address the issue included but not limited to:
1.	Mandated CWF county chairman, Mr. Stanley Vonzeah to launch a massive awareness campaign on the roles and responsibilities of the CWF personnel in the county.
2.	Re-vet the CWF membership with the full involvement of local leaders to include youth & women leaders’ town, clan and paramount chiefs.
3.	Report CWF members involved to police for prosecution.
issuename: CWF members run courts in rural Nimba

actionplandescription: Referred this issue to the NCSC
issuedescription: In previous Gbelay-Geh DSC meetings, the issue of limited police presence in the district was emphasized by both LNP commander and the District Superintendent. The DSC elevated this issue to the NCSC but while awaiting redress from the council, an order came from NLP authorities in Sanniquellie recalling five of the twelve officers assigned in the district. LNP district commander, Archie Dennis complained that this situation is creating panic among citizens and residents of the district in the wake of United Nations Mission’s complete withdrawal from Liberia

actionplandescription: Against this background, the DSC leadership constituted a committee to meet with the management of Radio Karn Voice of Peace, a local radio station in Karnplay to discuss the issue and find the way forward to addressing this concern. The committee will report to the DSC before its next meeting.
issuedescription:
Several citizens and residents of Gbelay-Geh Statutory District have reported to GbelayGgh DSC about the abuse of Press Freedom in the district by many persons thereby undermining the hard won peace of their country.
They asserted that people who speak on Radio Karn Voice of Peace especially political opponents castigate each other, incite supporters to physically attack opponents and publically accuse people without evidence.
Against this background, the DSC leadership constituted a committee to meet with the management of Radio Karn Voice of Peace, a local radio station in Karnplay to discuss the issue and find the way forward to addressing this concern. The committee will report to the DSC before its next meeting.

actionplandescription: The mediation committee will mediate the issue
issuedescription:
The Gbelay-Geh DSC received report from the Bahn family that members of Gormah‘s family in Behplay town. This issue has, according to sources from the Bahn family, lasted for five years without any solution in sight.
The DSC leadership, considering the potential threat this land dispute poses for the two families and by extension, the entire town, has constituted a special committee to mediate. The committee will commence work on July 6, 2016 and report at the July meeting

actionplandescription: Because of the sensitivity of the issue, the Y-DSC leadership designated four members of the intervention committee to meet with the Nimba County Administration to seek for redress to this concern.
issuedescription:
The acting paramount chief of Gbeleyee Chiefdom, Mr. Richard Gbantea reported to the Y-DSC that since the Karn Bridge got damaged as a result of flooding in September of 2015, the county government has paid little or no attention to the plight of the citizens and residents of Yarmein District.
The Karn River Bridge separates 85% of Yarmein District from the only commercial center in the district where farmers, petty traders, motor cyclists, students and transport service providers go to earn their living
issuename: Yarmein people risk separation from Nimba

actionplandescription: Y-DSC mediation committee is re- assigned to meet with AML management on July 15 to discuss the issue. The committee will report outcomes of the meeting with AML in the August meeting.
issuedescription:
The concern described below was discussed in June meeting with action taken to address it but the action point committee was unable to meet with AML management due to ill health of two members. The committee will implement the assignment and report in the August meeting.
Security actors on the Yarmein District Security Council reported at the June 1 meeting in Gbeleyee that the world giant steel company, Arcelor Mittal (AML) which is operating mining activities in Yarmein District, especially in the Gangla and Tokardah mines near Yekepa has resolved to abandoned their access road between Mts. Tokardah and Gangla to use a new road that passes through crowded communities in Yekepa for transportation of Iron Ore on 150 tons trucks.
 Citizens of Yarmein alerted security actors on the Y-DSC to consider it as a serious security concern because they fear it will affect them in many ways including air pollution by Iron Ore dust, danger to school going kids and light commercial vehicles plighting the streets of Yekepa.

actionplandescription: Following investigation, the two officers, Martin Wogbeh and his deputy were transferred from Gborplay to Karnplay where they will be under close monitoring by their commanders for few months before final decision can be reached by the council.
issuedescription:
In June, Gbelay-Geh DSC elevated to the NCSC the issue of harassment of Ivorian citizens by BIN officers assigned in Gborplay.
This issue was discussed by NCSC in its July 18 meeting and the council resolved that the officers involved be investigated and if found liable, be punished.

actionplandescription: DSC has decided to invite gas sellers to a meeting to figure out ways to handle the situation

issuename: Fear of imminent fire disaster in Zorzor City in connection with illegal storage of gasoline and other flammable goods

actionplannotes: BIN immediately decided to go to Wuomai to put the situation under control
issuedescription: A Guinean national who is an illegal alien residing in Wuomai has engaged in threatening to kill someone in Wuomai thereby leaving the whole town in a state of panic. According to the Liberian context, all aliens who reside in rural communities are supposed to have a citizen host (stranger father)  as it is normally being referred to. But this alien has no citizens host and has become problematic in the town.
issuename: Fear of imminent violence emulating from an illegal alien threatening to harm people in Wuomai
issuenotes: Did the DSC intervene in the referred case? What is the outcome of the intervention?
statusnotes: Issue awaiting DSC intervention

issuedescription: Johnson Kaway and Krubo Yongor both of Wakesu Town have gone at loggerheads over one farm - with each side claiming ownership of the farm. Two weeks ago, the dispute intensified and subsequently reached the attention of the Zorzor District Paramount Chief and the the Magistrate of the Zorzor magisterial Court before progressing to the joint DSC and CF meeting. Both the Paramount Chief and the Magistrate looked into the case but one said the Johnson is guilty and the other said Krubo is guilty - putting the issue in further chaos.
issuename: Johnson Kaway vs Krubo Yongor farm land dispute in Wakesu
statusnotes: Conflict serious but parties currently awaiting mediation

issuedescription:
The LNP commander of Wee-Gbeyi Administrative District and Co-Chairman of the- DSC, Sgt. Augustine Gbarlea Jr. reported to the W-DSC in its separate session on July 13 in Fleedin Town that Child Labor is on the increase in Saclepea City.
The commander asserted that children in the age range of 3-5 years are seen in all street corners and the main streets of Saclepea City selling food and other commodities.
Several members of the DSC confirmed this information and even provided updates that most of them are little girls who are usually target for rape and other abuses.
issuename: Child Labor on the increase in Saclepea

actionplandescription:
The city authorities recognizing the crucial role played by the Wee-Gbeyi DSC in resolving the Weh Creek criminal hideout issue, thought it wise to bring this security concern to the attention of the W-DSC for possible redress.
The W-DSC in its July 13 separate session lengthily discussed the issue and resolved to send an assessment team to authenticate the information and submit a written report   with recommendations for resolution to the W-DSC secretariat two weeks before August joint meeting of the structures
